column4: hey im having a problem installing ubuntu mabye you can help,  I got a live cd and it works and even passes the errror check, but it just will not install.  I always get an input output error
what type of coumputer u have Intel Core 2 or is it an older amd64 processor
hmm I don't know that much about 64-bit the I/O error could be anything
or your live cd iso could have went bad during download it's possible
oh and go get wine from http://www.winehw.org
and are u installing ubuntu to a partition or a second hard
are you running a windows install as well?
well ok I have found a way to make a grub floppy and cd
well I have made a guide that can help create a personal grub floppy or CD without messing with the MBR
I mainly made it for people who don't want to screw with windows being on the MBR since my windows install is the first HD
so if you use windows alot and want to try linux without GRUB being in the MBR thats what I mainly made it for
I will have to send it you but it needs to be worked on more
and I did this while using the live CD
it needs to be made to look extremely simple to do plus needs to be edited to use the new iso maker in hardy
I originally made this using Gutsy
well just in case u put windows back on the first HD you can create a Grub Boot Disk so your MBR if have windows on first HD grub won't install onto the MBR of the first HD
